log4ahk - Logging for AutoHotkey

Logs given String to given device. For more details see log4ahk

log4ahk

A class that provides simple logging facilities for AutoHotkey

This log-Class supports

  • Loglevels

  • Layout of the prepended string

Loglevels

Each message has to be logged on a certain loglevel. Consider the loglevel as the severity of the message you want to log: some logmessages are used for simple debug purposes, whereas other logmessages may indicate an Error.

  • Different hiearchical loglevels are Supported

  • The hierachy is trace (1) <- debug (2) <- info (3) <- warn (4) <- error (5) <- fatal (6)

Private Methods
_log()

Logs the given string at the given level

Parameters
str

String to be logged

loglvl

level on which the given message is to be logged

Internals

The given loglevel is compared against the global required fixlevel (see <required>) Is the given loglevel equal or greater the required loglevel the logmessage is printed - otherwise the logmessage is suppressed.

log4ahk.​layout

Helper class for log4ahk (Implementing layout)

Private Methods
_expand(ph)

Expands the placeholders with the values from the given array

Parameters
ph

associative Array containing mapping placeholder to its replacement

_split()

Splits the layout into its tokens

Properties
required [get/set]

Get/set the required layout

tokens [get]

Get the tokens of the current layout

Internals

The layout string is separated into its separate layout elements (tokens). For example "%8L %M" consists of two tokens: "%8L" and "%M". Each token starts with "%" and ends at the next space.  The tokens are split up into its separate parts.

log4ahk.​loglevel

Helper class for log4ahk (Implementing loglevels)

Properties
current [get/set] - get/set the current loglevel
required [get/set] - get/set the required loglevel
